noun.description: A wedge or block placed against a wheel or rounded object, to prevent it from moving.
examples: their aircraft stood gently shuddering against their chocks

noun.description: A fitting with a gap at the top, through which a rope or line is run.

verb.description: Prevent the forward movement of (a wheel or vehicle) with a chock.
examples: the front wheel will need to be chocked

origin: Middle English: probably from an Old Northern French variant of Old French çouche, çoche block, log, of unknown ultimate origin.
